    RodentsDataTutorial

    Matthew Latino

    2023-10-31

    RodentsDataTutorial.Rmd

    Introduction to My R Package for Proccessing Rodent Data

    This R package helps user work with functions to process and analyze rodent data. The functions used include clearing non applicable data from dataset, generate grahp plots, gives statistical Manova analysis, deviates numerical values, and records number of rodents present at each plot. Also, user can input different data columns of your choice to retrieve the desired analytical information as needed.

    Installing R Package for Rodent Data

    To install the R Package, copy and paste the following code into the console.

    devtools::install_github("matt-latino2/Latino2.pkg")
    ## Using github PAT from envvar GITHUB_PAT

    How to Download Surveys Data for R Package

    To download your data, click on the upload button in the “Files” tab in your R window. After, select the .csv file that contains the rodent surveys data set. To make the data functional in R, copy and paste the following codes individually into your console.

    #install.packages("googlesheets4")
library(googlesheets4)
googlesheets4::gs4_deauth()
surveys <- read_sheet("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pdc36LWryPtNrOrr2WudfGebYUtGLoOVuiZTu4jIs-4/edit?usp=sharing")

    ##Omitting NA Values from Data Set

    The first function allows the user eliminate the non applicable values from the dataset to visualize and analyze the data with complete data values

    ##Graphing Relationships between Data

    The second function creates a graphing plot using selected variables of
